page.title: 07THE FISH SCHEME.
page.content: { Dr Richards,}a local doctor, saw a need for help for some of the local inhabitants who had no-one to turn to when in distress. Through the local{parish church}he instigated the fish scheme in{1961} which is still being used by{St} {Andrew's Church.} The scheme helps the{blind, deaf,} {handicapped}and anyone else in need. The helpers and volunteers do everything that a good neighbour would do, as Jesus taught all{Christians}to do. Anyone likely to be in need has a card with a{fish symbol}on it. It can be placed in the window to attract help if they have no telephone. Most streets have a volunteer who will respond. The scheme has become internationally adopted from very humble beginnings.
